questions.question: Sam performed a vulnerability scan on his network and no problems were reported. He runs another tool that executes exploits against his system and the tool managed to execute three known exploits against his network. What kind of results did Sam receive from his vulnerability scan?
@`wotf is monitored using host-based intrusion detection systems (HIDS)?

Patricia would like to monitor her network for all incoming HTTP traffic to the HTTP server and all outgoing SSH traffic to an SFTP server outside the network using Wireshark. Which filter should she use?
@`wotf statements is true regarding a Network-based Intrusion Detection System (NIDS)?
options: NIDS only inspects packet headers of packets passing through the network.
[]NIDS is able to detect malicious file download by doing content inspection.
NIDS detects file modifications and deletions in a system to detect an attack.
NIDS is the only networking device that provides protection in a network.

questions.question: @`wotf statements is a true negative security alert classification?
options: []Normal network traffic is ignored and false alerts are not being triggered.
An alert is verified to be an actual security incident
Network attacks are not being detected by the intrusion detection system
An alert is triggered even though there is no security incident

questions.question: @`wotf detection methods uses established baselines and behaviours for detecting intrusions?
@`wotf is true about Host-Based Intrusion Prevention Systems?
options: It can be deployed on a network
It can be installed together with a firewall
[]It can generate alerts based on behaviour at the desktop level
It can detect malicious activities happening at the network layer
[]It can monitor changes to files and directories on a computer

questions.question: @`wotf is the most suitable detection method for port scanning attack?
@`wotf nmap timers will likely be detected quickly by the intrusion detection system?
Statistical anomaly detection is also ___
options: used for detecting cross-site scripting attacks
used to flag out normal network traffic activity

questions.question: You were alerted to a large influx of network traffic to a particular server in your network. Upon investigating the network packets captured, you noticed that there were many SYN packets being sent to multiple ports. What kind of malicious activity did the attacker perform?
@`wotf is the TCP flag value for an RST/ACK packet?
@`wotf SNORT rules will accurately detect all replies from any FTP server?
options: alert ip any any -> any 21 (msg:"Reply Detected"; classtype:misc-activity; sid:10000001; rev:1;)
alert tcp any any -> any 21 (msg:"Reply Detected"; classtype:misc-activity; sid:10000001; rev:1;)
alert tcp any 21 -> any any (msg:"Reply Detected"; classtype:misc-activity; sid:10000001; rev:1;)
alert ip any 21 -> any any (msg:"Reply Detected"; classtype:misc-activity; sid:10000001; rev:1;)

questions.question: Refer to the network traffic below. Which of the following commands was most likely used by the attacker in this attack?
@`wotf is/are counteracting solutions to fragmentation attacks?
@`wotf techniques can be used to defend against ARP Spoofing?
options: Disable the ARPspoof preprocessor in Snort
Disable the Dynamic ARP Inspection (DAI) feature on network switches

questions.question: @`wotf activities is NOT useful in evading signature-based intrusion detection systems?
options: Create different variants of a malware

questions.question: @`wotf is used to perform session hijacking?
Which statement based describes 'content: '100 00 00 001';' used in a Snort rule?
options: It is a unique content that should be used often in signature-based detection
It is commonly used as a content for anomaly-based detection
[]It is too common and should not be used in signature-based detection
It is used to detect null scans

questions.question:
Refer to the Snort rule below. Which statement best describes this Snort rule?
alert tcp any any -> 192.168.1.0/24 111 (msg:"snort rule"; content:"|00 01 86 a5|"; sid:1234;)
options: An alert is generated when a TCP packet is generated from any IP on the 192.168.1.0 subnet and destined to any IP on port 111 with the content "|00 01 86 a5|"
[]An alert is generated when a TCP packet from any IP address is destined for any IP address on the 192.168.1.0 subnet on port 111 with the content "|00 01 86 a5|"
An alert is generated when any packet other than a TCP packet is destined for any IP address on the 192.168.1.0 subnet on port 111 with the content "|00 01 86 a5|"
An alert is generated when a TCP packet from port 111 of any IP address is destined for any IP on the 192.168.1.0 subnet on port 111 with the content "|00 01 86 a5|"

questions.question: Event correlation...
options: Identifies anomalies to check if a system is vulnerable to attack
[]Identifies links between events and how they are related
Is the process of investigating Windows Event Logs
Is the process of investigating Snort alerts
